intro: Shawia gunniana, commonly known as the mountain daisy, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and thistles. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Shawia gunniana typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, sunny conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for horticultural study and conservation efforts.
